content.text:
Which of the following chords belongs to the first inversion of a major-minor seventh chord (including both close and open voicings)? <image 1>

A. BD
B. CD
C. BC
D. AB

To determine which chord belongs to the first inversion of a major-minor seventh chord (including both close and open voicings), we need to identify the chord that has the following characteristics:

1. It contains a major third (the third note of the chord).
2. It contains a minor seventh (the seventh note of the chord).
3. It has both a close and an open voicing.

Let's analyze each chord:

A. BD - This chord contains a minor third (B) and a minor seventh (D). It has a close voicing (B) and an open voicing (D).

B. CD - This chord contains a major third (C) and a minor seventh (D). It has a close voicing (C) and an open voicing (D).

C. BC - This chord contains a major third (B) and a minor seventh (C). It has a close voicing (B) and an open voicing (C).

D. AB - This chord contains a major third (A) and a minor seventh (B). It has a close voicing (A) and an open voicing (B).

Based on the characteristics of the chords, the chord that fits the description of a major-minor seventh chord with both close and open voicings is:

B. CD
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
